MIKE STEVENS TO PILOT
GRID TEAM NEXT SEASON

Mike Stevens, more dignifiedly
known about Chevy Chase, Md., a.-.
Myron IT. will captain the 192 J
foot hull team at Maryland, this im-
por;an* detail having been attend-
ed to j11st prior to the Christmas
Holidays when the Varsity and
Freshmen squads also were ban-
queted in the dining hall.
While it is pretty well known
about the campus and in other pre
cincts that Mike has been chosen
gridiron leader, the news, of course,
r ever has been properly broadcast-
ed until it is printed in The
Diamondback, and this is the first
issue of College Park’s leading
newspaper since the occasion of
'lie election and the feed.
Is Tlirce-LHter Man
.Mike, who is a three letter man
in athletics and also an out in
trout man in'his studies, just now
is playing with the Varsity basket
ball team. latter on he will be
cavorting on the diamond.
At the banquet President Woods
praised foot ball as a college asset;
Prof. Richardson gave an interest-
ing talk on “What we are and what
we hope to be:’’ John Ennis told of
the worries of a foot ball manager,
with reference to some of the prima
donna’s of the squad, while Retir-
ing Captain Bill Supplee spoke of
the l!l2.r> season and Captain-Elect
Stevens looked ahead to 192(i. Re-
presentatives Millard E. Tydlngs
was toastmaster and scored a touch-
down every time he took the ball.
Fetters are Awarded
Prof. Broughton awarded the
“M’s” to the Varsity players and
numerals to the leading members
of the Freshmen squad, as follows:
Varsity.
Bill Supplee, Bill Beatty, Walter
Bromley, Ralph Lanigan, Arthur
Bonnet, Earl Zulick, Donald Adams,

ens, Edward Tenney, Lewis Thomas,
